pros: Great team, great benefits, good work (helping people get into affordable housing).

review_title: Homes  First rating in comparison to the other organizations
pros: Good Management, organized, adheres to organization procedures, culture, diversity and inclusion respected
cons: Could do better with a slightly higher pay

pros: There were some kind, and generous staff, and supervisors. Some of the staff were among the most skilled people I have met in my career.
cons: A few of the long-term staff were dreadful-lazy, indirect, and unfriendly with the residents, and clients of the shelters.

pros: working for housing organizations in general is not an easy job, but HomesFirst is one of the best (if not the one). Pretty organized, good management and pay is not too bad either
cons: you are stuck in your shift until your relief shows up or supervisor finds a new person.

pros: Challenging environment, working with vulnerable populations doing important work. Building connections with service users and helping them to make a difference. Flexible hours. Ability for growth in company.
cons: Management can be bad depending on the supervisor. Some can abuse their power.

review_title: Good Experience to the field of addictions and mental health
